title: Will our way of life change as much in the next hundred years as it has in the last hundred years? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, probably not. The 20th century was a hundred years of enlightenment. Beginning a the turn of the century, civilization started advancing more rapidly than any other time in history. By the 60’s, things were changing so fast that it became known as ‘future shock.” Things have calmed down considerably over the past 30 years. Although, with the advent of the internet and smart phone, that sense of technology has been steady. But from now on you most likely won’t see things change a whole lot for quite a while.

That life you had before the 11 January 2020 has gone. From now on until each and everyone of us dies, we will have to live under strict rules of self isolation, restrictions, and face covering in a public place. Sport venues, music concerts, and just groups of friendly people socializing has all gone, and all because someone wants to change the world, and make it a better place.
